intro: Magnolia pacifica, commonly known as the Santa Cruz magnolia, is a deciduous tree native to the coastal regions of California. It is characterized by its large, showy, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The leaves are broad, ovate, and have a smooth texture, turning yellow in the fall before dropping. The tree typically grows to a height of 10–20 meters and thrives in well-drained soils. It plays an important ecological role in supporting local wildlife and is valued for its ornamental beauty.
